# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Sure, I'll follow your special instructions and prioritize them over the general Julia language guidelines. Here's the function `wrap_string` based on your instructions:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if length(current_line) > 0
                current_line *= " " * word
            else
                current_line = word
            end
        end
    end
    if length(current_line) > 0
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
